item.name: Civil Service and Agency Organization Subcommittee
Civil Service and Agency Organization Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization.

Referred to the Committee on House Administration, and in addition to the Committee on Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on House Administration, and in addition to the Committee on Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on House Administration, and in addition to the Committee on Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

summary.text: Amends the Legislative Branch Appropriations Act of 1999 to eliminate the requirement that the Public Printer make an additional contribution to the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund for each Government Printing Office employee to whom a voluntary separation incentive payment has been paid on or after April 1, 2003.

bill.title: To eliminate the requirement that the Public Printer make an additional contribution to the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund with respect to each employee of the Government Printing Office to whom a voluntary separation incentive payment has been paid.

item.title: To eliminate the requirement that the Public Printer make an additional contribution to the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund with respect to each employee of the Government Printing Office to whom a voluntary separation incentive payment has been paid.

To eliminate the requirement that the Public Printer make an additional contribution to the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund with respect to each employee of the Government Printing Office to whom a voluntary separation incentive payment has been paid.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
